title: 109_hr3512
content: The Act is titled the "Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2005, Part VI" and addresses administrative expenses for the Federal-aid highway program. SEC. 2. ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES FOR FEDERAL-AID HIGHWAY PROGRAM: Authorization of contract authority increased to $309,260,880. Limitation on obligations for administrative expenses of the Federal Highway Administration set at $17,080,960 for a specific period in 2005. Conforming amendment made to adjust dates. SEC. 3. ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES FOR NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION. The Highway Trust Fund provides $4,125,000 for administrative expenses of the National Highway Traffic Administration for various highway safety programs and initiatives. These funds are available for obligation in the same manner as apportioned under title 23, United States Code. The Highway Trust Fund provides funds for administrative expenses of the National Highway Traffic Administration for highway safety programs, available until expended. SEC. 4 amends the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2004 regarding administrative expenses for the Motor Carrier Safety Administration program. SEC. 5 addresses administrative expenses for Federal Transit Programs. SEC. 5 amends the authorization of appropriations and obligation ceiling for Federal Transit Programs. SEC. 6 amends the budget for the Bureau of Transportation Statistics and allocates funds for administrative expenses. SEC. 7 extends the authorization for the use of trust funds for obligations under TEA-21. The amendment to the Highway Trust Fund under the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2005, Part VI, changes the deadline from July 31, 2005, to August 15, 2005. The Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2005, Part VI, amends the deadline for the Highway Trust Fund from July 31, 2005, to August 15, 2005, and includes changes to the mass transit account in the tax code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates related to the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund, specifically regarding the Sport Fish Restoration Account and Boat Safety Account. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates related to the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund, specifically regarding the Sport Fish Restoration Account and Boat Safety Account. The Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2005, Part VI, amends provisions related to the Highway Trust Fund until August 15, 2005. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend appropriations and tax rates for the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund. Certain temporary provisions related to the Fund are repealed. The amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act, except for the amendments made by subsection (d) which will take effect on the date of the enactment of the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act.
